critique: The document is an executive order focused on ensuring federal employees meet child support obligations. It emphasizes federal government's role in enforcing child support, cooperation between federal agencies and states, and setting an example as a model employer. There is no discussion of immigration. The document does not explicitly expand executive power but directs federal agencies to take specific actions. It leans towards federal oversight in child support enforcement. It balances security and liberty by focusing on legal obligations. It involves government in ensuring financial support for children. It promotes social inclusion by ensuring children receive support from both parents.
